laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked decrease in perfusion and a slight decrease in ventilation in the left lung.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: On the third hospital day, it showed no perfusion of the left lung.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Pulmonary arterial pressure estimated to be 75 mm Hg.
Urinary sediment contained 3 to 5 red cells and 3 to 5 white cells per low-power field.
Hemoglobin 36.3%, WBC count 9700 per cubic millimeter (66% neutrophils, 25% lymphocytes, 6% monocytes, 2% eosinophils, 1% basophils), platelet count 242,000 per cubic millimeter.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Back to normal range after heparin treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 91, inverted T waves in leads V1 and V2, low upright T waves in lead V.
